page.title: 14Rolvenden's Korker Sausages
page.content: Each day vans carry the name of{ {Rolvenden's Kent Korker Sausages}to shops in the South and the Midlands from Jim Hoad's factory in Rolvenden. Mr. Hoad specialised in making pork sausages in the 1970's when he noticed that with the growth of supermarkets fewer people bought all their meat at his two village butcher's shops. The small factory employs 16 people who make over 50,000 sausages a day. The sausages are made from pork, cereal binder, salt, pepper and sage. 90% of the sausages made are frozen in the factory and taken in insulated vans to be sold in their frozen state. The factory also makes "porkburgers" and pre-packed meat products. Mr. Hoad expects that in the future he will be making more "fast food" products as microwave cooking becomes more popular with busy housewives.
